religious symbols (e.g., crosses, stars of David)
a rectangular or rounded top shape
names, dates of birth, and death

often has a ribbon or band around the base of the crown
commonly black, but can also be seen in other colors

braze-ons for attaching additional accessories like water bottle cages and lights
front and rear racks for carrying panniers or bags
longer wheelbase for stability and comfort
multiple gear options for handling various terrains
tower-pisa: circular base and series of columns around each level
traffic-light: presence of regulatory signage nearby (e.g., stop signs, pedestrian signals)
vertical or horizontal pole or frame
treadmill: safety key or clip often attached to the panel
triceratops: three facial horns (one on the snout and two above the eyes)
large bony frill at the back of the head
often depicted in a prehistoric or natural landscape setting
tricycle: pedals typically located near the front wheel
often a small front wheel compared to the rear wheels
sometimes colorful and designed for children
trilobite-101: Segmented body with three distinct lobes (left pleural lobe, central axial lobe, right pleural lobe)
tripod: a mounting plate or head for attaching a camera or other device
locking mechanisms on the legs or head
rubber feet or spikes at the end of each leg
often made of metal, carbon fiber, or plastic
t-shirt: generally loose-fitting and casual in style
comes in various colors and patterns
tuning-fork: usually made of metal (often silver or steel)
two prongs (tines) extending parallel from a base
prongs often have a rounded end
a round handle or stem at the base of the fork
tweezer: typically silver, black, or brightly colored
umbrella-101: Long, central shaft (often metal or wood)
Tip at the top of the shaft
Collapsible mechanism (may be manual or automatic)
Handle at the bottom of the shaft (may be curved or straight)
unicorn: frequently depicted in white or other bright colors
often depicted with a flowing mane and tail
typically depicted in fantasy or mythical settings
a single, spiraled horn on its forehead

input ports for connecting to other devices (HDMI, VGA, USB)
control buttons or a small control panel on the top or sides
cooling vents or fans on the sides or back

watch-101: A strap or band that may be made of leather, metal, plastic, or fabric
Hour, minute, and possibly second hands
May have additional features like sub-dials, date windows, or digital displays
Buttons around the face/dial for additional functions (common in digital or multifunction watches)
waterfall: A continuous cascade or series of cascades
A body of water, such as a river or stream, feeding into the waterfall
Movement blur of water captured in the photo
Mist or spray near the base of the falling water

vibrant red or pink flesh (if cut open)
textured or smooth surface on the rind
welding-mask: sometimes has side windows for peripheral vision

a large, open container or tray
typically made of metal or plastic
often used for carrying heavy loads

sometimes a small building or housing at the base
materials such as wood, metal, or concrete

dark green, brown, or clear color

a series of wooden or metal bars
bars of varying lengths (longer bars produce lower pitches, shorter bars produce higher pitches)
mallets or sticks typically used to play the instrument
bars arranged in a horizontal layout

might be seen in religious or ceremonial contexts
can be knit, cloth, or suede
fits snugly without straps or ties

usually made of plastic, wood, or metal
a string winding around the axle
may have a small knob or indentation in the center for gripping
some models might have design patterns or logos on the discs

long tail with a tuft of hair at the end
airplanes-101: one or more engines (jet engines or propellers)
a fuselage (the main body of the airplane)
car-side-101: Side mirrors protruding near the front windows

patterns or treads on the outsole for traction

camouflage pattern or markings on the skin
